titlealts.searchtitle: Supporting Information: Organisation Coding Frames - Description

div.p: For further information, see the attribute ORGANISATION CODE.
ORGANISATION CODING FRAMES

li.p: All NHS ORGANISATIONS are coded using coding frames, as shown in the tables below:

div.p: Example Non NHS Organisation (Independent Provider) e.g. 8HA03
Example Local Service Provider e.g. LSP01
Also:
Example School e.g. EE134290
Example Care Trust e.g. TAK
Also:

entry.p: (CSU) / Data Services for Commissioners Regional Office (DSCRO)
High Level Health Geography, e.g. Sustainability and Transformation Partnership

div.p: Example Government Office Region (GOR) e.g. K
Note: Government Office Region (GOR) is identified by a one character code; no other one character code exists.
Example Pharmacy Headquarters e.g. P001
Also:
Example GP Practices in England and Wales e.g. Y00001
Also:
Example Cancer Network e.g. N01

li.p: N0 (where the 2nd character is numeric and not alpha) = Organisation Type Identifier

div.p: Also:

entry.p: Booking Management System (BMS) Call Centre Establishment

div.p: Example Special Health Authority (SpHA) e.g. T1150
Example NHS Wales Informatics Service e.g. W00
Example Northern Ireland Local Commissioning Group e.g. ZC010
Characters 1-3 (ZC0) AND character 5 (0) = Organisation Type Identifier

p.i: Note: this is a 5 character method of displaying Northern Ireland Local Commissioning Group identifiers. Characters 3 and 5 are 'fillers'. If a 3 character code is required (as used by the Office for National Statistics in the NHS Postcode Directory) zeros can be omitted, e.g. ZC1. The 3 character method of displaying the Northern Ireland Local Commissioning Group identifiers fit under the H Frame. Guidance on the use of Northern Ireland codes can be found in Data Set Change Notice 19/2009.

div.p: Example Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG) e.g. 12A
12A = Organisation and Organisation Type Identifier
Also:
Example GP Abeyance and Dispersal GP Practice e.g. G7817414
The structure and format of ORGANISATION CODES maintained by the Organisation Data Service, NHS Prescription Services, NHS Dental Services and other agencies are detailed in the tables below.
ORGANISATION CODES TABLES
Table 1: CODING FORMATS FOR ORGANISATIONS IN ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.p: Booking Management System (BMS) Call Centre Establishment

p.b: All Cancer Registries in England are now part of the National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service

entry.p: Commissioning Support Unit (CSU) / Data Services for Commissioners Regional Office (DSCRO)
First three characters denote Executive Agency

p.b: Government Office Regions (GORs) closed 31 March 2011 - from 1 April 2011 referred to as Regions

entry.p: GP Abeyance and Dispersal GP Practice
GP Practices in England and Wales
Char 1 = W for Welsh GP Practice.
All other values represent GP Practices in England.

p.b: Note: from 2003, ALL newly allocated Practice Codes in England begin with a Y

entry.p: High Level Health Geography, e.g. Sustainability and Transformation Partnership
A, B, D, G, I, K, L, M , N, O, S, U, V, W

p.b: Only one organisation of this type exists for Wales

entry.p: Northern Ireland Health & Social Care Board
Northern Ireland Health & Social Care Trust
Department for Health, Social Services and Public Safety (DHSSPS), Northern Ireland

Note that characters 3 and 5 are 'fillers' to create a 5 character code. If a 3 character code is required (as used by the Office for National Statistics in the NHS Postcode Directory), zeros can be omitted and fits under the H frame: E.g. ZC1. Guidance on the use of Northern Ireland codes can be found in
Data Set Change Notice 19/2009
.

p.b: All Primary Care Trusts closed 31 March 2013
All Strategic Health Authorities in England closed 31 March 2013

div.p: Codes for Executive Agency, Executive Agency Programme, Executive Agency Site and Executive Agency Programme Department do not easily fit into the coding frames as shown above and are therefore not included. This is due to their unusual structure in that there are more hierarchical 'tiers' than with other organisations.

p.i: Executive Agency and Executive Agency Programme are both considered Organisation level entities, although each Programme does have a relationship to an Executive Agency. Executive Agency codes are three characters long. Executive Agency Programme codes are six, and their first three characters are the same as the Executive Agency they are associated to.

Department codes of eight characters long can then be allocated underneath a Programme code (sharing the first six characters). Executive Agency Site codes of five characters long can be allocated under an Executive Agency code (and share the first three characters).

div.i: A-9 indicates that characters A-Z and 0-9 are valid: except B, I, O, S, U and Z (to avoid ambiguity). This applies to all
in the Coding Format Table above except

div.p: Table 2: CODING FORMATS FOR ORGANISATIONS IN SCOTLAND
Scottish ORGANISATION CODES are supplied by the Information Standards Directorate (ISD) from NHS Scotland and published by the Organisation Data Service.

entry.p: 2nd character identifies the Health Board the GPFH reports to. 3rd character (always B) shows GPFH status.
2nd character identifies the Health Board the organisation reports to. 3rd character identifies the organisation type: A= Health Unit C = Hospital Trust D = Nursing Home

div.p: Table 3: CODING FORMATS for ORGANISATIONS in OTHER HOME COUNTRIES

p.i: Note: A-9 indicates that characters A-Z and 0-9 are valid: except B, I, O, S, U and Z (to avoid ambiguity).
